column4: Hmm, quick question: IF I compile a deb on HedgeHog will it work on Heron, or vice versa?
anyone know?
ok thnx
Other thing, how do I compile things without internet access? Or could some one do it...
it's my modem driver...
you'll need to use another computer with net access to download build-essential and its dependencies from http://packages.ubuntu.com
usually a matter of installing build-essential, then reading the readme or install files
It's extremely easy to compile "if" you have an internet connection. Could some one do it for me who has internet connection. :)

just use another computer to put the .deb packages for build-essential and its dependencies on a disc to transfer the packages to the one without the internet connection.  YOu can get the packages from http://packages.ubuntu.com
Where can I get the packages for "hedgehog"?
hedgehog?
The original ubuntu. O_o
why can't you compile it yourself?

I can't compile it since the compiler tool is online. (When I get hardy I'll download the compilers from the site). But the run command for getting it off the cd doesn't exist. It just says downloading and then "can't connect". :s
check http://packages.ubuntu.com
I wanted to test it for Hoary while Hary's in the mail. (Hoary is discontinued)
wine has partial Direct3D support.  Windows games that use OpenGL work almost perfectly
Is there a way to install packages from my Ubuntu CD?
for that first one, what kind of connection do you have and did you recently download a lot on it?
External Dial-Up modem. No I didn't download much and it's fast on WinXP. But not on Ubuntu.
Would you remeber what that site was that had an autodetect driver for Lucent Winmodem's? I think the comapny started with a C... they had Lucent in their name and a driver which cost money/
I don't think so
